snippet: Prosecutors in several states say embezzlement investigations involving youth sports have become common....
abstract: Emergence of American youth sports as nonprofit business earning reported $9 billion annually is accompanied by surge in embezzlement and other corruption cases; experts say mounting problem, exacerbated by lack of professional oversight in industry, often involves volunteers who are well-known and admired in their communities.

byline.contributor: Susan C. Beachy and Doris Burke contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Prosecutors in several states say embezzlement investigations involving youth sports have become common.

headline.main: The Trusted Grown-Ups Who Steal Millions From Youth Sports
headline.print_headline: Youth Sports Go Broke as Trusted Adults Steal
